Module execute
Package org.zuky.dialogs

Class ColorDialog

java.lang.Object
org.zuky.dialogs.ColorDialog
public class ColorDialog extends Object
This class Represents the WinAPI custom color selection dialog box.

The dialog box does not support the alpha channel and in that case the alpha channel or transparency is ignored.

See Also:
  • Color Dialog Box - Win32

  • Constructor Details

    • ColorDialog

      public ColorDialog()
      Create an instance of this class
      See Also:
      • ColorDialog(int[])

    • ColorDialog

      public ColorDialog(int[] colors)
      Creates an instance of this class where it receives an array of integers that defines the color of each ColorDialog box.
      Parameters:
      colors - - array of integers defining the color of each cell
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - the array is null
      IllegalArgumentException - the array size exceeds the maximum amount defined by MAX_CUSTOM_COLORS
      See Also:
      • setColors(int[])

  • Method Details

    • show

      public boolean show(Window parent)
      Displays the dialog box specifying the parent window for the modal state
      Parameters:
      parent - - the parent window
      Returns:
      true if the dialog box was closed correctly or false if it was canceled or an error occurred.

    • setFullOpen

      public void setFullOpen(boolean fullOpen)
      When opening the dialog box you can indicate whether it should be displayed with the extension to edit the RGB colors.
      Parameters:
      fullOpen - - show edit extension

    • isFullOpen

      public boolean isFullOpen()
      Returns true if ColorDialog is displayed with extension
      Returns:
      full open

    • getColor

      public Color getColor()
      Returns the last color that was selected. If you have not selected a color the result will be a black color.
      Returns:
      color

    • getColors

      public int[] getColors()
      Returns an array with the colors of the boxes including custom and selected colors.
      Returns:
      array of colors
      See Also:
      • setColors(int[])

    • setColors

      public void setColors(int[] colors)
      Define the colors to be displayed in each box of the dialog box

      The alpha channel or transparency is ignored because Windows ColorDialog is not supported.

      Parameters:
      colors - - array of colors
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - the array is null
      IllegalArgumentException - the array size exceeds the maximum amount defined by MAX_CUSTOM_COLORS
      See Also:
      • MAX_CUSTOM_COLORS
      • getColors()

    • show

      public boolean show()
      Display the dialog box without defining a parent window
      Returns:
      true if the dialog box was closed correctly or false if it was canceled or an error occurred.
      See Also:
      • show(Window)
